calories.name: Calories
calories.description: Energy unit that measures how much energy food provides. Essential for all bodily functions including breathing, circulation, and physical activity.

protein.name: Protein
protein.description: Macronutrient essential for building and repairing muscles, bones, skin, and other tissues. Also supports immune function and enzyme production.

carbs.name: Carbohydrates
carbs.description: Primary energy source for the brain and muscles. Provides quick and sustained energy. Includes both simple sugars and complex carbohydrates.

fat.name: Fat
fat.description: Essential for absorbing fat-soluble vitamins (A, D, E, K), hormone production, and brain health. Provides more energy per gram than carbs or protein.

fiber.name: Fiber
fiber.description: Indigestible carbohydrate that supports digestive health, helps regulate blood sugar, and promotes satiety. Reduces risk of heart disease and certain cancers.

iron.name: Iron
iron.description: Mineral essential for transporting oxygen throughout the body via hemoglobin in blood. Prevents anemia and supports energy metabolism.

calcium.name: Calcium
calcium.description: Major mineral for building and maintaining strong bones and teeth. Essential for muscle contraction, nerve transmission, and blood clotting.

vitaminD.name: Vitamin D
vitaminD.description: Fat-soluble vitamin that regulates calcium absorption, supports bone health, and strengthens immune system. Produced by skin exposure to sunlight.

vitaminC.name: Vitamin C
vitaminC.description: Water-soluble vitamin that supports immune function, collagen production, and iron absorption. Acts as an antioxidant to protect cells from damage.

vitaminA.name: Vitamin A
vitaminA.description: Fat-soluble vitamin crucial for vision, immune function, and skin health. Plays role in cell growth and differentiation.

potassium.name: Potassium
potassium.description: Essential mineral that regulates blood pressure, supports heart function, and maintains proper muscle contraction and nerve transmission.

sodium.name: Sodium
sodium.description: Mineral that regulates fluid balance, blood pressure, and nerve function. Most people consume excess sodium; limit to less than 2,300mg daily.

magnesium.name: Magnesium
magnesium.description: Mineral involved in 300+ biochemical reactions in the body. Supports muscle and nerve function, energy metabolism, and bone health.

zinc.name: Zinc
zinc.description: Trace mineral essential for immune function, wound healing, protein synthesis, and DNA formation. Supports taste and smell perception.

omega3.name: Omega-3 Fatty Acids
omega3.description: Essential polyunsaturated fats that reduce inflammation, support heart and brain health, and regulate mood. Includes EPA, DHA, and ALA.
